Detailed Description

802.15.4 protocol module.

802.15.4 MAC and CSMA sequence: handler functions. A more feature-rich implementation of the MAC, using acknowledgements and beacons (when configured to do so) Supports only long address format

Define Documentation

#define LAST_SLOT_12   4052

#define SLOT_12   40672
 

Timeslot synch value for superframe

portCHAR rf_802_15_4_handle (  buffer_t *  buf  ) 
 

Standard nanostack buffer handler.

Function prefilters buffers and forwards downward buffers to rf_802_15_4_queue-table.

Function has the following states:

  • CONNECT, this case only forwards data frames to upper and from upper layers
  • DISCONNECT, forward just mac-commands and acks
  • BEACON_TRACK, forward only beacon framesopen-zb_ref_guide_v1.1.pdf to rf_802_15_4_queue
  • AD-HOC, forward only data and ack frames

Handle also analyze packets MAC header from Radio. After header analyze process continue based on frame type.

Parameters:
buf Buffer to process
Returns:
pdTRUE Buffer handled by this module

pdFALSE Buffer rejected by module

portCHAR rf_802_15_4_init (  buffer_t *  buf  ) 
 

Standard nanostack module initalizer.

Returns:
pdTRUE OK

Variable Documentation

xQueueHandle buffers
 

Common variables

uint16_t channel_list = 0
 

Mac task.

Reads message queues from rf_802_15_4_queue and detects buffer type. Types: HANDLE_RX, HANDLE_TX and HANDLE_CONTROL. HANDLE_RX, detect frametype and forward data to upper. HANDLE_TX, build data-frame based on source and destination address. HANDLE_CONTROL, from NWK_CONFIG-module task handle: send response back.

Parameters:
pvParameters not used
